data.translatedDescription: The federal government's communication to the EU contracts was sometimes unhappy. This week again in terms of protective clause. But that shouldn't distract from the essentials.

data.title: INTERVIEW - Santiago Calatrava: «In der Notre-Dame begriff ich zum ersten Mal, dass die Architektur existiert – es ist das Licht, das sie zum Leben erweckt»
data.description: Eigentlich wollte der Architekt Santiago Calatrava Maler werden. Dann wurde er in der Kathedrale Notre-Dame in Paris zur Architektur bekehrt. Im Gespräch mit Roman Bucheli erzählt er, dass er trotzdem sein Leben lang gemalt habe und dass er in Zürich die besten Bedingungen für seine Lebens- und Arbeitsweise fand.
data.translatedTitle: Interview - Santiago Calatrava: "In the Notre -Dame I understood for the first time that the architecture exists - it is the light that she brings to life»
data.translatedDescription: The architect Santiago Calatrava actually wanted to be a painter. Then he was converted to architecture in the Cathedral of Notre-Dame in Paris. In an interview with Roman Bucheli, he says that he had still painted his life and that he found the best conditions for his way of life and working in Zurich.

data.title: Kita-Gesetz: «Dass das Parlament die Kosten einseitig der Wirtschaft aufbürden würde, damit war nicht zu rechnen»

data.translatedDescription: The employers have shot their own goals with the daycare law. Barbara Zimmermann from the Swiss employers' association takes a stand.

data.title: Gefährden tiefere Medikamentenpreise die Innovation? Big Pharma investiert mehr in Marketing und Dividenden als in Forschung
data.description: Die Pharmaindustrie zittert um die hohen Medikamentenpreise in den USA. Die Branche rechtfertigt diese seit Jahren mit den hohen Kosten für Forschung und Entwicklung. Doch das ist nur die halbe Wahrheit.

data.translatedDescription: The pharmaceutical industry trembles for the high medication prices in the USA. The industry has justified this for years with the high costs of research and development. But that's only half the truth.

data.title: Saudi Arabia’s annual inflation rate holds steady at 2.3% in April: GASTAT
data.description:
RIYADH: Rent increases and fuel price rises helped Saudi Arabia post an inflation rate of 2.3 percent in April — the same level as a year earlier — official data showed.

	According to the latest figures from the General Authority for Statistics, a 6.8 percent increase in the cost of housing, water, electricity, gas, and other fuels contributed to the rise.

	Within this category, rents paid for housing rose by 8.1 percent, driven by an 11.9 percent spike in apartment rental prices, a category that holds significant weight in the overall index.
data.translatedTitle: Saudi Arabia’s annual inflation rate holds steady at 2.3% in April: GASTAT
data.translatedDescription:
RIYADH: Rent increases and fuel price rises helped Saudi Arabia post an inflation rate of 2.3 percent in April — the same level as a year earlier — official data showed.

	According to the latest figures from the General Authority for Statistics, a 6.8 percent increase in the cost of housing, water, electricity, gas, and other fuels contributed to the rise.

	Within this category, rents paid for housing rose by 8.1 percent, driven by an 11.9 percent spike in apartment rental prices, a category that holds significant weight in the overall index.

data.title: Haaland eyes FA Cup to save face after Man City’s ‘horrific’ season
data.description:
MANCHESTER: Erling Haaland said Manchester City must deliver in the FA Cup final on Saturday to salvage something from a “horrific” season that saw them deposed as English champions for the first time in five years.
	City face Crystal Palace at Wembley aiming to avoid a first trophyless campaign since Pep Guardiola’s debut season in charge in 2016/17.
	Guardiola’s men sit fourth in the Premier League, 18 points adrift of champions Liverpool, and in a battle just to secure a top-five finish and Champions League football next season in their final two league matches.
data.translatedTitle: Haaland eyes FA Cup to save face after Man City’s ‘horrific’ season

	Guardiola’s men sit fourth in the Premier League, 18 points adrift of champions Liverpool, and in a battle just to secure a top-five finish and Champions League football next season in their final two league matches.

data.title: Ben Sulayem drives major improvements to FIA’s international Sporting Code
data.description: DUBAI: The Federation Internationale de l’Automobile, the global governing body for motor sport and the federation for mobility organizations worldwide, has announced that it is to make major improvements to Appendix B of its International Sporting Code following an extensive review commissioned by FIA’s President Mohammed Ben Sulayem.

data.title: Russian delegation arrives in Turkiye for Ukraine war talks
data.description:
ISTANBUL: Russia’s delegation arrived in Istanbul for peace talks with Ukraine, Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova said Thursday, and a Ukrainian official said a delegation including President Volodymyr Zelensky was on its way the the Turkish capital Ankara.
	Russian President Vladimir Putin was not part of the delegation from Moscow, however, according to a list released by the Kremlin Wednesday night, prompting criticism from Western officials that the Kremlin isn’t serious about the peace effort.
data.translatedTitle: Russian delegation arrives in Turkiye for Ukraine war talks

data.title: Lufthansa group suspends Tel Aviv flights following Houthi attacks on Israel
data.description:
BERLIN: Airline group Lufthansa will suspend its flights to Tel Aviv through May 25, it said on Thursday, citing the “current situation.”
	This affects flights operated by Lufthansa, Swiss, Austrian Airlines, Eurowings, ITA Airways, Brussels Airlines and Lufthansa Cargo, it added.
	Global airlines have again halted their flights to and from Tel Aviv after a missile fired by Yemen’s Houthis toward Israel on May 4 landed near the country’s main international airport in Tel Aviv.

data.title: Al-Ain to host 6th IMMAF Youth World Championships in July
data.description:
ABU DHABI: The UAE Jiu-Jitsu and Mixed Martial Arts Federation has announced that the sixth IMMAF Youth World Championships will be held in Al-Ain Region for the first time from July 21-27.

	The tournament will be staged at the Al-Ain Convention Center with more than 1,000 male and female athletes from 60 countries competing in the championship’s largest event to date.

data.title: India says Pakistan nuclear arsenal should be under UN surveillance
data.description:
SRINAGAR: Pakistan’s nuclear arsenal should be brought under the surveillance of the UN’s nuclear agency, Indian Defense Minister Rajnath Singh said Thursday, following last week’s conflict between Islamabad and New Delhi.

	“I wanted to raise this question for the world: are nuclear weapons safe in the hands of a rogue and irresponsible nation?” Singh told troops at a base in Srinagar in Indian-administered Kashmir.

data.title: Madinah municipality continues intensive food safety inspections
data.description:
MADINAH: Food safety inspections have been stepped up ahead of the arrival of Hajj pilgrims, reported the Saudi Press Agency on Thursday.

	The Madinah Regional Municipality has carried out routine testing of commercial establishments, with 4,165 samples to date confirmed as conforming to approved standards. So far, 186 samples have been deemed unfit for human consumption.

data.title: Trump: India has offered US a trade deal with zero tariffs
data.description:
RIYADH: US President Donald Trump said on Thursday in Doha that India had offered the US a trade deal with zero tariffs.

	New Delhi is seeking to clinch a trade deal with the US within the 90-day pause on tariff hikes announced by Trump on April 9 for major trading partners, which had included a 26 percent tariff on India.

	“It is very hard to sell in India, and they are offering us a deal where basically they are willing to literally charge us no tariffs,” Trump said in a meeting with executives in Doha.
data.translatedTitle: Trump: India has offered US a trade deal with zero tariffs

	“It is very hard to sell in India, and they are offering us a deal where basically they are willing to literally charge us no tariffs,” Trump said in a meeting with executives in Doha.

data.title: Jordan evacuates second group of cancer patients from Gaza
data.description:
AMMAN: Jordan’s government on Wednesday began evacuating four child cancer patients and 12 family members from Gaza.

	They are the second group of patients evacuated for treatment under the Jordan Medical Corridor initiative, started in March this year, that aims to treat 2,000 Gazan children.

	The children and their families were evacuated by the Royal Jordanian Air Force in cooperation with the World Health Organization and the Ministry of Health.

	They will be treated at the King Hussein Cancer Center.

data.description: La ONG Justicia, Encuentro y Perdón anunció este viernes el fallecimiento de Wilmer García, ex preso político que padecía autismo y enfermedad renal crónica, quien sufrió grave deterioro de salud durante la reclusión.  La organización aseguró en un comunicado que García “falleció como consecuencia de las complicaciones derivadas del abandono al que fue sometido” durante […] La entrada Murió Wilmer García, ex preso político que sufrió deterioro de salud en la cárcel se publicó primero en EL NACIONAL .
